content: O Allah, I ask You for guidance, piety, chastity, and self-sufficiency.
context: Du'a asking Allah for guidance on the right path, piety and God-consciousness (taqwa), chastity and moral purity, and self-sufficiency so as not to depend on others.

content: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from anxiety and sorrow, weakness and laziness, miserliness and cowardice, the burden of debts and from being overpowered by men.
context: Comprehensive du'a of the Prophet ﷺ seeking refuge from all forms of emotional and psychological distress—anxiety, depression, sadness, feeling overwhelmed, burnout, laziness, financial stress, debt, and feeling powerless or dominated by others.

content: Our Lord, give us good in this world and good in the Hereafter, and protect us from the punishment of the Fire.
context: The most frequently recited du'a of the Prophet ﷺ. A comprehensive supplication asking for the best of both worlds—success, happiness, health, and provision in this life, and Paradise in the next.

content: O Allah, forgive me my sins, my ignorance, my extravagance in my affairs, and what You know better than me.
context: Du'a for forgiveness of all types of sins—those committed knowingly, out of ignorance, or through excess. For someone seeking repentance and a fresh start after making mistakes.

content: O Allah, I ask You for the good of this day, its success and its help, its light, its blessing, and its guidance.
context: Morning du'a asking Allah to bless the day ahead with success, productivity, barakah, light, and divine guidance. For starting the day with purpose and hope.

content: O Allah, set right my religion which is the safeguard of my affairs, and set right my worldly life wherein is my livelihood, and set right my hereafter to which is my return.
context: Du'a for balance and rectification of all dimensions of life—spiritual wellbeing, worldly matters like career and finances, and preparation for the afterlife. For someone seeking overall life improvement and balance.

content: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from the evil of what I have done and the evil of what I have not done.
context: Du'a seeking protection from the consequences of past sins and future potential harms—both what one has already done and what one might do.

content: There is no god but You, Glory be to You. Indeed, I have been of the wrongdoers.
context: The du'a of Prophet Yunus (Jonah) ﷺ from the belly of the whale. One of the most powerful du'as for moments of extreme distress, crisis, feeling trapped, hopelessness, or when all doors seem closed. The Prophet ﷺ said no Muslim supplicates with this except that Allah answers.

content: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from a heart that is not humble, a soul that is not satisfied, knowledge that does not benefit, and a supplication that is not answered.
context: Du'a seeking refuge from spiritual diseases—a hard heart that doesn't submit to Allah, a soul that's never satisfied (greed, envy), knowledge without action, and prayers made without sincerity.

content: O Allah, I ask You for beneficial knowledge, good provision, and accepted deeds.
context: Concise du'a combining the three essentials of a successful life: knowledge that benefits, sustenance that is good and halal, and deeds accepted by Allah. For students, professionals, and anyone seeking meaningful success.

content: O Allah, You are my Lord. There is no god but You. You created me and I am Your servant. I try my best to keep my covenant with You and to live in the hope of Your promise. I seek refuge in You from the evil of what I have done. I acknowledge Your blessings upon me and I acknowledge my sins. So forgive me, for none forgives sins but You.
context: Sayyid al-Istighfar—the master du'a of seeking forgiveness. The Prophet ﷺ said whoever says this with conviction in the morning and dies that day enters Paradise. The most complete form of repentance and turning back to Allah.

content: O Allah, make me content with what You have provided me, bless me in it, and replace every absent thing with something better.
context: Du'a for contentment and patience with what Allah has decreed. For someone who has lost something, is missing something in their life, or struggling to be grateful. Asking Allah to replace what's gone with something better.

content: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from incapacity, laziness, cowardice, senility, and miserliness. And I seek refuge in You from the torment of the grave and the trials of life and death.
context: Du'a seeking refuge from things that prevent action and productivity—incapacity, laziness, procrastination, cowardice, stinginess. Also seeking refuge from the trials of death and the grave.

content: O Turner of hearts, keep my heart firm upon Your religion.
context: One of the Prophet's ﷺ most frequent du'as. For someone experiencing doubt, wavering faith, spiritual low, or wanting to stay firm on the straight path. Acknowledges that hearts can change and only Allah can keep them steady.

content: O Allah, benefit me with what You have taught me, teach me what will benefit me, and increase me in knowledge.
context: Du'a for students and seekers of knowledge. Asking Allah to make what you've learned beneficial, to teach you more, and to keep increasing your understanding. For exams, school, university, studying, or any learning journey.

content: O Allah, I ask You for health, chastity, trustworthiness, good character, and contentment with what has been decreed.
context: Du'a for five foundational qualities: good health, moral purity, being trustworthy, excellent character, and contentment with Allah's decree (qadr). For someone working on self-improvement and accepting what Allah has written.

content: O Allah, grant me health in my body. O Allah, grant me health in my hearing. O Allah, grant me health in my sight. There is no god but You.
context: Du'a specifically for physical health and healing. For someone who is sick, recovering from illness, has health problems, or wants to preserve their physical wellbeing—body, hearing, and sight.

content: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from hunger, for it is the worst companion; and I seek refuge in You from treachery, for it is the worst secret trait.
context: Du'a seeking refuge from severe poverty, hunger, and being betrayed. For someone struggling with food insecurity, financial hardship, or who has been betrayed by others.

content: O Allah, place light in my heart, light in my sight, light in my hearing, light on my right, light on my left, light above me, light below me, light in front of me, light behind me, and grant me light.
context: Du'a asking Allah to fill every aspect of one's being with divine light and guidance. For someone seeking clarity, direction, purpose, or feeling lost in darkness and confusion.

content: O Allah, I ask You for Paradise and whatever brings me closer to it of words and deeds. And I seek refuge in You from the Fire and whatever brings me closer to it of words and deeds.
context: Comprehensive du'a for the hereafter—asking for Paradise and everything that leads to it, while seeking protection from Hellfire and everything that leads to it.

content: O Allah, forgive me, have mercy upon me, guide me, enrich me, give me health, grant me sustenance, and raise my rank.
context: Seven comprehensive requests in one du'a: forgiveness, mercy, guidance, spiritual and material enrichment, good health, sustenance, and elevation in rank. A complete supplication for every need.

content: O Allah, distance me from my sins just as You have distanced the East from the West. O Allah, purify me from my sins as a white garment is purified from filth. O Allah, cleanse me of my sins with snow, water, and ice.
context: Beautiful du'a for purification from sins using vivid imagery. For someone burdened by guilt, shame, or past mistakes, asking Allah to thoroughly cleanse and purify them.

content: O Allah, I ask You, as all praise is Yours, there is no god but You, the Bestower, the Creator of the heavens and the earth, Owner of Majesty and Honor; O Ever-Living, O Self-Sustaining.
context: Du'a beginning with praising Allah through His greatest names and attributes. The Prophet ﷺ said this du'a contains Allah's greatest name (Ism al-A'zam) through which du'as are answered.

content: O Allah, help me to remember You, to be grateful to You, and to worship You in an excellent manner.
context: Du'a asking for help with the three pillars of spiritual life: remembering Allah consistently, being grateful for His blessings, and worshipping Him with excellence (ihsan). For someone wanting to improve their spiritual connection.

content: O Allah, I have greatly wronged myself and no one forgives sins but You. So grant me forgiveness from You and have mercy on me. You are the Forgiving, the Merciful.
context: Du'a taught by the Prophet ﷺ to Abu Bakr for use in prayer. For someone deeply aware of their sins and shortcomings, seeking Allah's expansive forgiveness and mercy with humility.

content: O Allah, I seek Your guidance through Your knowledge, and I seek Your help through Your power, and I ask of Your great bounty; for You are able and I am not, You know and I do not, and You are the Knower of the unseen.
context: Du'a of Istikhara—the prayer for guidance when making important decisions. For choosing between options in marriage, career, moving, business, or any life decision. Surrendering the outcome to Allah's superior knowledge.

content: O Allah, make the Quran the spring of my heart, the light of my chest, the departure of my sorrow, and the relief of my anxiety.
context: Du'a asking Allah to make the Quran a source of emotional and spiritual healing—removing sorrow, depression, sadness, and anxiety. For someone going through emotional pain seeking comfort in the Quran.

content: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from the decline of Your blessings, from a change in Your protection, from Your sudden punishment, and from all Your wrath.
context: Du'a for preserving the blessings you currently have. For someone who fears losing what they have—health, wealth, family, safety—and seeks protection from Allah's displeasure.

content: O Allah, grant my soul its piety, and purify it—You are the best to purify it. You are its Guardian and Master.
context: Du'a for spiritual purification (tazkiyah) of the soul. For someone seeking inner purity, God-consciousness, and wanting to cleanse their heart from spiritual diseases.

content: O Allah, there is no ease except what You make easy, and You can make difficulty easy if You wish.
context: Du'a for ease during difficulty and hardship. For someone facing obstacles, struggling with something challenging, or going through a tough period. A reminder that only Allah can turn hardship into ease.

content: In the Name of Allah, with whose Name nothing on earth or in heaven can cause harm, and He is the All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
context: Morning and evening protection du'a. The Prophet ﷺ said whoever says this three times in the morning and evening, nothing will harm them. For protection from harm, evil eye, and danger.

content: Sufficient for me is Allah; there is no god but He. On Him do I rely, and He is the Lord of the Mighty Throne.
context: Du'a of complete reliance on Allah (tawakkul). For someone who is worrying excessively, overthinking, or struggling to trust in Allah's plan. The Prophet ﷺ said whoever says this seven times, Allah will suffice him.

content: O Allah, I ask You for steadfastness in all my affairs, and determination in following the right path.
context: Du'a for consistency, perseverance, and determination. For someone struggling with discipline, wanting to stay on the right path, or needing motivation to persist in their goals.

content: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from helplessness, from sloth, from cowardice, from old age, and from the torment of the grave.
context: Du'a seeking refuge from spiritual and physical weakness that prevents action—helplessness, laziness, fear, and the decline of old age.

content: O Allah, Lord of the seven heavens and Lord of the Magnificent Throne, be for me a support against the evil of all Your creatures.
context: Du'a for divine protection from the harm of all creation. For someone feeling threatened, dealing with enemies, or seeking safety from those who wish them harm.

content: O Allah, I ask You for well-being in this world and the Hereafter. O Allah, I ask You for forgiveness and well-being in my religion, my worldly life, my family, and my wealth.
context: Comprehensive du'a for well-being (aafiyah) in every dimension of life—religion, worldly affairs, family relationships, and financial security. The Prophet ﷺ highly valued asking for aafiyah.

content: O Allah, conceal my faults and calm my fears.
context: Short but powerful du'a asking Allah to hide one's flaws and shortcomings from others and to replace fear with security. For someone dealing with anxiety, fear of exposure, embarrassment, or insecurity.

content: O Allah, I entrust You with what I have read and studied. Return it to me when I need it. You are my Protector and are the best of those to be trusted.
context: Du'a for students after studying, asking Allah to preserve what they've learned and return it to them during exams and when needed. For exam preparation, tests, and memorization.

content: O Allah, I ask You for a tongue that remembers You, a heart that is thankful to You, and a body that is patient with trials.
context: Du'a for the three qualities every believer needs: a tongue busy with dhikr, a grateful heart, and a body that endures trials with patience (sabr). For someone seeking patience during hardship and tribulation.

content: O Allah, You are the Most Forgiving, You love to forgive, so forgive me.
context: The du'a the Prophet ﷺ taught Aisha for Laylatul Qadr (the Night of Power). A concise, powerful supplication for forgiveness, especially recommended during Ramadan and the last ten nights.

content: O Allah, inspire me with right guidance and protect me from the evil of my own self.
context: Du'a for protection from one's own ego (nafs) and destructive desires. For someone battling temptation, bad habits, or their own worst impulses.

content: O Allah, I ask You for the means to do good, to avoid evil, and to love the poor.
context: Du'a for three beautiful qualities: the ability to do good deeds, the strength to avoid evil, and a heart filled with compassion for the less fortunate.

content: We have come to the morning/evening and at this very time the whole kingdom belongs to Allah. All praise is due to Allah. None has the right to be worshipped except Allah alone, having no partner.
context: Daily morning and evening remembrance (adhkar). A declaration of Allah's sovereignty at the start and end of each day, establishing the daily spiritual routine.

content: O Allah, bring us closer to what will bring us closer to Paradise, of statements and actions, and keep us away from what will bring us closer to the Fire, of statements and actions.
context: Du'a asking for guidance in both speech and actions toward Paradise and away from the Fire. For someone who wants to align their entire life—words and deeds—with what pleases Allah.

content: O Allah, I ask You for a good end to all my affairs, and I seek refuge in You from the humiliation of this world and the punishment of the Hereafter.
context: Du'a for a good ending (husn al-khatima)—that the conclusion of one's life and all affairs ends well. Also seeking protection from disgrace in this world and punishment in the next.

content: O Allah, make me grateful to You, remembering You, fearing You, obedient to You, humble before You, turning to You in repentance.
context: Du'a for essential spiritual qualities: gratitude, constant remembrance of Allah, healthy fear (khashya), obedience, humility, and a repentant heart. For spiritual growth and closeness to Allah.

content: O Allah, I ask You by every name that belongs to You, which You have named Yourself, or revealed in Your Book, or taught any of Your creation, or kept hidden in the unseen with You—make the Quran the spring of my heart.
context: The full version of the du'a for relief from depression and sadness, invoking Allah by ALL His names. The Prophet ﷺ said whoever says this, Allah will remove their sadness and replace it with joy.

content: O Allah, the Lord of Jibreel, Mikaa'eel and Israafeel, Originator of the heavens and the earth, Knower of the unseen and the seen. You judge between Your servants in what they used to differ. Guide me by Your permission in what is the truth.
context: Du'a from the night prayer (tahajjud/qiyam al-layl). Asking for guidance to the truth when matters are confusing or disputed. For seeking clarity and divine direction.

content: O Allah, do not let my heart deviate after You have guided me, and grant me mercy from You. Truly, You are the Bestower.
context: Du'a for protection from going astray after being guided. For someone who fears losing their faith, experiencing doubt, or straying from the right path after Allah had guided them.

content: I seek refuge in the perfect words of Allah from the evil of what He has created.
context: Du'a for protection from all evil in creation. The Prophet ﷺ especially recommended it when traveling or staying somewhere new. Protects from harm, jinn, insects, and all created beings.

content: O Allah, I ask You for patience when things do not go my way, and I ask You for contentment with my lot. And I ask You for a coolness of life after death, and the pleasure of gazing upon Your Face, and a longing to meet You.
context: Du'a specifically for patience (sabr) when things don't go as planned. For someone going through trials, disappointment, loss, or hardship and needing the strength to persevere and accept Allah's decree with grace.

content: O Allah, bless me in my marriage, and bless my spouse for me, and unite us in goodness.
context: Du'a for blessings in marriage. Based on the Prophet's ﷺ du'a for newlyweds. For someone getting married, seeking a spouse, wanting to improve their marriage, or asking for a righteous partner.

content: May Allah bless you, and may He bless upon you, and may He join you together in goodness.
context: The du'a the Prophet ﷺ would say to congratulate newlyweds. For someone attending a wedding, getting married, or praying for a couple's blessed union and harmonious marriage.

content: O Allah, I ask You to grant me love of You, love of those who love You, and love of deeds that bring me closer to Your love.
context: Du'a for divine love—asking for love of Allah, love of righteous people, and love of good deeds. For someone wanting to strengthen their relationship with Allah and feel spiritual closeness.

content: O Allah, make me patient and make me grateful. Make me small in my own eyes and great in the eyes of others.
context: Du'a combining patience (sabr) with gratitude (shukr), humility with dignity. For someone seeking the balance of being patient in hardship while remaining grateful, and humble yet respected.

content: O Allah, I ask You for a righteous spouse who will help me in my religion and my worldly life.
context: Du'a for finding a righteous spouse and life partner. For someone who is single and looking for marriage, feeling lonely, wanting a halal relationship, or asking Allah to grant them a pious and compatible partner.

content: Our Lord, grant us from among our spouses and offspring the coolness of our eyes, and make us leaders of the righteous.
context: Du'a for happiness in family life—a loving spouse, righteous children, and being a role model. For someone wanting a happy marriage, good children, family harmony, or starting a family.

content: Verily with patience comes victory. Verily with hardship comes ease. And verily with difficulty comes relief.
context: Prophetic wisdom about the relationship between patience and success. For someone going through prolonged hardship, trials, or difficulty who needs encouragement that patience will lead to relief and victory.

content: How wonderful is the affair of the believer! Everything is good for him—and this is only for the believer. If something good happens to him, he gives thanks, and that is good for him. If something bad happens to him, he has patience, and that is good for him.
context: The Prophet's ﷺ teaching on the believer's mindset: every situation is a win. Good times call for gratitude and bad times call for patience. For someone struggling with a difficult situation or wanting to develop patience and a positive outlook on life's tests.

content: No fatigue, nor disease, nor sorrow, nor sadness, nor hurt, nor distress befalls a Muslim, even if it were the prick of a thorn, except that Allah expiates some of his sins for that.
context: Prophetic promise that every suffering a believer endures—no matter how small—erases sins. For someone in pain, going through illness, or suffering, reminding them that their patience is not wasted but rewarded by Allah.

content: O Allah, I ask You to make my love for You the most beloved thing to me, and my fear of You the most fearful thing to me. Remove from me all worldly needs by instilling a passion for meeting You.
context: Du'a for detachment from worldly obsessions and attachment to Allah instead. For someone too attached to material things, struggling with worldly desires, or wanting to prioritize their spiritual life over dunya.

content: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from grief and sadness, from inability and laziness, from cowardice and miserliness, and from being overcome by debt and overpowered by people.
context: The Prophet's ﷺ comprehensive du'a against emotional and mental struggles. Grief about the past, anxiety about the future, inability to act, laziness, financial burden, and feeling dominated. For someone experiencing depression, burnout, financial stress, or feeling completely overwhelmed.

content: Whenever a matter became difficult for the Prophet ﷺ, he would turn to prayer.
context: The Prophet's ﷺ personal practice of turning to prayer whenever something became difficult. For someone going through stress or hardship, encouraging them to find solace and solutions through salah.

content: O Allah, do not make this world our greatest concern or the extent of our knowledge, and do not place over us those who do not show us mercy.
context: Du'a asking Allah not to make worldly life the main focus of one's existence, and to protect from merciless authority. For someone who feels consumed by worldly pursuits or is under oppressive leadership.

content: O Allah, show me the truth as truth and grant me the ability to follow it, and show me falsehood as falsehood and grant me the ability to avoid it.
context: Du'a for clarity and discernment between right and wrong. For someone confused about a situation, unsure what's true, making difficult moral decisions, or seeking wisdom to distinguish truth from falsehood.

content: O Allah, I ask You for a sound heart, a truthful tongue, a body that endures with patience, and a faith that does not waver.
context: Du'a for four qualities of strong character: a pure heart, honest speech, physical patience and endurance through trials, and unwavering faith. For someone wanting strength of character and patience.

content: O Allah, make my spouse the coolness of my eyes, and make me the coolness of their eyes. O Allah, join us together in goodness and if You separate us, then make the separation in goodness.
context: Du'a for marital happiness and harmony. Asking Allah for a loving, peaceful marriage where both partners find joy in each other. Also includes acceptance of Allah's will regarding the outcome. For couples, newlyweds, or those seeking marriage.

content: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from knowledge that does not benefit, from a heart that is not humbled, from a soul that is never satisfied, and from a du'a that is not answered.
context: Du'a seeking refuge from four spiritual diseases: useless knowledge (no action), a hard heart, insatiable greed, and rejected supplications. For someone wanting to purify their spiritual state.

content: O Allah, I ask You for guidance, piety, purity, and self-sufficiency. O Allah, guide me among those You have guided, protect me among those You have protected, and befriend me among those You have befriended.
context: Du'a from Witr prayer combining guidance, God-consciousness, purity, and independence from creation. Asking to be counted among those Allah has specially guided, protected, and taken as friends.

content: When one of you marries a woman, let him take hold of her forelock, mention the name of Allah, and pray for blessing. Say: O Allah, I ask You for the goodness within her and the goodness she was created with, and I seek refuge in You from the evil within her and the evil she was created with.
context: Du'a taught by the Prophet ﷺ for the wedding night and when beginning married life. Asking for the best in your spouse and seeking refuge from any harm. For newlyweds starting their life together.

content: O Allah, grant me patience, for patience is the head of faith, and the greatest struggle is the struggle against one's own self.
context: Du'a for patience (sabr) with the understanding that it is the foundation of faith. For someone battling their own desires, trying to exercise self-control, overcoming temptation, or needing discipline and perseverance.

content: O Allah, ease my sadness, remove my grief, and answer my du'a.
context: Short, powerful du'a for someone going through deep sadness, grief, or depression. Asking Allah for relief from emotional pain and for du'as to be answered.

content: O Allah, put barakah (blessing) in our marriages, our homes, and our children.
context: Du'a for divine blessing (barakah) in the three foundations of family life: marriage, home, and children. For someone wanting harmony at home, blessings in their marriage, or righteous children.

content: O Allah, give me patience to bear what You have decreed, and make me find comfort in what You have destined for me, so that I do not wish to hasten what You have delayed or delay what You have hastened.
context: Du'a for deep patience with Allah's timing and decree (qadr). For someone frustrated by waiting, wanting something to happen sooner, impatient with their circumstances, or struggling to accept what Allah has written for them.
